results.title: [Nicoll Family Home Movies: Reel 1]
results.brief_description:
Alexander (Alex) Nicoll (1898–1968) grew up in Princes Hill in Melbourne.

As a young man, and after working in various capacities, Alex met wealthy business owner Arthur Thomas who assisted him into business running an import agency at Tasmania House in Flinders Lane. Alex would enjoy a lifelong involvement with Melbourne’s ‘rag trade’ (clothing business) in Flinders Lane, including serving for some years as the President of the Victorian Softgoods Association.

In the 1930s Alex inherited an Agfa 16mm camera, projector and collapsible screen from Arthur Thomas who had been a keen photographer, and over the 1940s and 1950s would capture wonderful moments around Melbourne such as the celebrations for the 1956 Olympics and visits to the beaches of Port Phillip Bay.

After Alexander died, his son Mac continued the family filming enthusiasm in the 1960s and 1970s. Around 2005, the Nicoll family decided to donate most of their collection of films to ACMI.

This reel captures a military parade likely to be sometime in the 1940s down Alexandra Parade, Moonee Ponds and some garden views.

Selected highlight list:

00:00:00:05 a crowd lines the street (most likely Mt Alexander Road near Moonee Ponds Town Hall, the family lived in Essendon)
00:00:00:28 soldiers parade down the street before a crowd of onlookers
00:00:00:51 parade passes a dais on which people stand, one in a mayoral robe and chain of office
00:01:12:00 military trucks and equipment can be seen in the parade
00:01:38:00 soldiers relaxing on the lawn with members of the crowd after the parade

results.title: Correspondences: Víctor Erice and Abbas Kiarostami [exhibition]: archival material
results.brief_description:
“Correspondences” was an ACMI Screen Gallery Exhibition, held 21 August 2008 - 2 November 2008.

See Exhibition activity record “Correspondences” (ID 35 ) for more information

Spanish director Víctor Erice’s small but acclaimed body of work has been widely acknowledged for its poetic and masterful storytelling. Iranian filmmaker Abbas Kiarostami is regarded as a master of contemporary world cinema, voted by many critics as the most important director of the nineties.

Although these two great filmmakers met face-to-face only once before this exhibition, they discovered powerful parallels in their interests and ideas. Featuring film, photography and new work created especially for the exhibition, Correspondences represents the long distance creative dialogue and intimate rapport that developed between Erice and Kiarostami.

results.title: Stories from Birchip
results.creator_credit: David Meagher, Dean Lawry, Jason White, Astrid Scott and ACMI Content Development
results.brief_description: Ten stories recorded by ACMI in the Mallee town of Birchip (and one about an Art Deco cinema in nearby Charlton) to celebrate the annual Small Towns summit hosted by Birchip in August 2007. Each film created to be a part of the ACMI MAP (Memory and Place) project is under 7 minutes long and is specifically about relationship to place.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Meagher, Dean Lawry, Jason White, Astrid Scott and ACMI Content Development

results.title: KOK 28mm hand cranked projector
results.brief_description: In 1912, the popular Pathé Kok camera and projector arrived, which used the more standard 28mm film and cast a 30-inch picture.
results.description:
28mm hand crank projector designed by Pathe. Designed for home use, the Pathe KOK projector uses non-flammable cellulose acetate safety film and an electric light. The projector is powered by a crank handle. Contains: projector, hand crank, metal cover, 2 x metal reels.
Sticker on reel says “The property of Visual Education Centre, Education Dept. Victoria”
See video of same model (modified) of projector in use: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SG9Nvly1UB4
Was ACMI Lending Collection/ACMI Collection in 2014 audit - NR says unclear, but should keep.
28 mm gauge metal projector on wooden base.Object functions.

results.title: Country is my life
results.creator_credit: John Lovett, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Johnnie Lovett endeavours to express his love for country music, how it feeds his spirit and the people who have inspired and encouraged him to become a musician in the first place.

results.title: Home, the old place, Little Dunmore
results.creator_credit: Eileen Alberts, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Eileen Alberts remembers the home of her past, her family’s history and her spiritual home. It is the place that has made her the person she is and where she returns to soothe her soul and strengthen her spirit.

results.title: Good evil deeds
results.brief_description:
Good Evil Deeds (GED) is a short interactive Macromedia Flash animation about a young woman Audrey who’s doomed to an early death. Choices made in GED will send Audrey to one of three places in the afterlife: Hell, Purgatory or Heaven.
Inspired by the French film “Amelie”.
